bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Telegram from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, May 29, 1941

div1.p: Kellogg has read Hench's address on the unveiling of Cornwell's painting with pleasure. He will rearrange the schedule and have sections of the speech released to the press.

div1.head: Telegram from George A. Kellogg to Philip Showalter Hench, May 29, 1941
div1.p:
WESTERN
UNION
1201
(43)
R. B. WHITE
PRESIDENT
NEWCOMB CARLTON
CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD
J. C. WILLEVER
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
__________________________________________________
The filing time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
1941 MAY 29 AM 10 49
MAJ84 TWS PAID 3=JERSEY CITY NJ 29 1156A
DR PHIL S HENCH=
=MAYO CLINIC

HAVE READ YOUR ADDRESS WITH GREAT PLEASURE. WE ARE ALL
ENTHUSIASTIC ABOUT IT. YOUR SUGGESTION FOR REARRANGEMENT
OF SCHEDULE TELEPHONED TO MR LAW THIS MORNING AND
ACCEPTED. OUR PRESS REPRESENTATIVE WILL NOT ABSTRACT
THE SPEECH BUT WILL MARK SECTIONS OF RELEASE FOR
SPECIAL ATTENTION TO EDITORS. MAYOR OF CLEVELAND
ACCEPTED INVITATION=

GEORGE A KELLOGG.
THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
